meetup-AngularJS-Bucharest-237874563.description:
Hello friends,

We're excited to announce our first event of the year and it's going to be a bit different than what we've done before. We're trying out a new concept and we hope it'll catch on :)

Together with our friends at JSHacks we're kicking off a series of events called JSHacks Sessions. The main idea is to host small-scale events (15-20 participants) and discuss to-the-point JavaScript topics in a presentation/workshop/discussion fashion in a super friendly and cozy atmosphere. Hosts of the events will likely be competent professionals in the to-be-discussed topic and will gladly share their experience. If you can't make it to this event, don't worry. We're likely to make as many as we can, also taking into consideration feedback/demand/popularity.

For the first event in the series, we're tackling ES6 (or ES2015 or ESNext) with a walk through all the changes and new features that will take JavaScript development to a whole new level. Among others, we'll discuss block scoping variables, arrow functions, classes, enhanced objects, iterators, generators and a bunch more. The session is aimed at those who worked with ES5 but haven't had a lot of opportunities to play around with ES6 and want to learn more about it's potential. Concepts won't be covered in too much depth (each topic could easily deserve its own session), mostly due to time limitations. But it'll give you a first impression of the power using ES6 unleashes.

Your host will be Andrei Antal, co-organizer for Angular Bucharest Meetup, co-member in the JSHacks community and JavaScript technologies enthusiast.

Although the main focus will be a presentation of the concepts (with occasional side discussions) some plunks will be provided so you can try out the examples for yourself. You're welcomed to bring your laptops (only a functional browser is required).


NOTE:  A small fee of 4euros will be charged for your participation. Due to very limited attendance space, we kindly ask that you apply only if you know that you can attend. No refunds are possible.

Hope to see you there and let this be the start of an exciting series of events in our awesome community!

Have a productive day,

AngulaJS Bucharest and JSHacks team
meetup-AngularJS-Bucharest-237874563.title: JSHacks Sessions: ES6 walkthrough
meetup-AngularJS-Bucharest-237874563.venue: ARIA Cafe (aka Hack Cafe): Strada Dimitrie Onciul 33, București , Bucharest

meetup-Bucharest-Data-Science-Meetup-235.description:
This session will be an introductory talk on how to use Neo4J ( https://neo4j.com/ ) in its capacity as a graph analytics engine. The target audience is SQL developers.

We'll start with an overview of Neo4J and its query language Cypher before moving on to a few worked examples where we'll build and query the same data set using first relational databases and then Neo4J.

We'll also cover graph modeling, query optimization and show an example of procedures which were introduced in the 3.0 version of Neo4J.

What is Neo4J?

Here's a good summary by Emil Eifrem, creator of Neo4J:
Most applications today handle data that is deeply associative, i.e. structured as graphs (networks). The most obvious example of this is social networking sites, but even tagging systems, content management systems and wikis deal with inherently hierarchical or graph-shaped data.
This turns out to be a problem because it’s difficult to deal with recursive data structures in traditional relational databases. In essence, each traversal along a link in a graph is a join, and joins are known to be very expensive. Furthermore, with user-driven content, it is difficult to pre-conceive the exact schema of the data that will be handled. Unfortunately, the relational model requires upfront schemas and makes it difficult to fit this more dynamic and ad-hoc data.
A graph database uses nodes, relationships between nodes and key-value properties instead of tables to represent information. This model is typically substantially faster for associative data sets and uses a schema-less, bottoms-up model that is ideal for capturing ad-hoc and rapidly changing data.
meetup-Bucharest-Data-Science-Meetup-235.title: Presentation - Beginners - Introduction to Neo4J

meetup-Bucharest-Deep-Learning-237924549.description:
(Recurrent) neural networks are usually trained to make predictions over a fixed number of classes. However, this limitation affects problems where the output size depends on the size of the input sequence. Pointer networks open up a new class of combinatorial optimization problems that can be solved by cleverly repurposing the well-known attention mechanism.

Papers: Pointer Networks, https://arxiv.org/abs/1506.03134


Prior knowledge: recurrent neural networks


The presentation will be held in Romanian.

meetup-Bucharest-Mobile-Development-Meet.description:
Hey all,  


We're glad to announce a new Mobile Developers Meetup, on February 27th 2016!  

Join us for two presentations at the Microsoft HQ, the sponsor of the event. 
Drinks and snacks included.

---

1. Kotlin features for Android - Valentin Iorgu, Lead Mobile Developer at mReady

The Android development experience has improved considerably in the last couple of years thanks to some great libraries and tooling improvements but we're still stuck with an outdated version of Java while other platforms get shiny new toys like Swift. 


You might have heard of Kotlin (also during our last meetup), but how exactly does it help?
In this presentation we'll go over several Kotlin features that help reduce boilerplate, can increase the stability of your codebase and enhance the overall development experience.

We'll explore things like inline functions, reified generics, receiver lambdas, delegated properties, sneak peak  at coroutines and more.

---

2. Azure for Android – Radu Matei, Technical Evangelist at Microsoft

In this hands-on presentation, we will explore the capabilities of building your Android application by creating a cloud-based back-end, with integrated authentication and authorization, offline data sync, push notifications and autoscale.


See you there,  
The Mobile Academy team

---

Agenda
18:30 - 19:00 Registration & networking  
19:00 - 19:40 Valentin Iorgu, mReady 
19:40 - 20:20 Radu Matei, Microsoft 
20:20 - 21:00 Networking

meetup-Cluj-Napoca-OpenStreetMap-Meetup-.description:
At our next event we will continue to improve OpenStreetMap by adding missing roundabouts via MapRoulette.

MapRoulette is a fun way to fix missing roundabouts in OpenStreetMap. In MapRoutelle one solves map tasks - where one task equals a potential problem in OpenStreetMap - one looks at this challenges and provides a "resolution" (fix it, not a problem, or skips the challenge).

Requirements:

·  As the event will be focused exclusively on editing, please bring a laptop and charger

·  (optional) JOSM installed on your laptop.

If you want to read more about roundabout mapping check out the following pages:

• http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Tag:junction%3Droundabout

• http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Tag:highway%3Dmini_roundabout
meetup-Cluj-Napoca-OpenStreetMap-Meetup-.title: OSMTime – Adding missing roundabouts using MapRoulette (2nd edition)

meetup-Cluj-Napoca-WordPress-Meetup-2375.description:
Hello hello!

On February 27th we're meeting up again.

This meetup will be in the form of an open discussion / knowledge sharing, structured on 2 themes:

1. How to choose a theme 

We'll be discussing how we evaluate a theme, try to put together a list of useful suggestions for anyone looking to setup a new WordPress site.

2. Our go-to Plugins

We'll take turns discussing about the plugins we use most often. What do they do, what alternatives are there, who uses what.

We've pushed back the date in hopes that we'll be able to find someone to give us a talk about developing themes for selling them on ThemeForest. Unfortunately we haven't managed to find anyone yet. 


So this is also an open call for all you theme developers out there - if you wanna give a talk in the Cluj Meetup, please contact us. (We can also, if you're unable to visit our wonderful city, do this online on skype , hangouts, or you name it).

Looking forward to seeing you all!

meetup-CoFoundersLab-Cluj-237952963.description:
ClujHUB aduce, în premieră, speakerii și conținutul conferinței și mai aproape de voi, comunitatea cu care merită să împărtășim ideile.

Vă invităm duminică, 26 februarie, la seria atelierelor HUB Workshops with TEDxCluj Speakers!

Prof. Dr. Varujan Pambuccian va vorbi la TEDxCluj 2017 - Going Beyond despre cele patru direcții care modelează societatea umană: robotica industrială, inteligența artificială, bioinformatica și fabricația aditivă.

Post-eveniment, la invitația ClujHUB, domnul Pambuccian va dezvolta subiectul Economiei Digitale într-un workshop cu participare gratuită, la care sunteți invitați. 

Evenimentul va avea loc duminică, 26 februarie, între 11:30-13:30 la Cluj Hub. Participarea la eveniment este gratuită dar înregistrarea pe Xing Events este obligatorie. 

Varujan Pambuccian este Doctor în matematică al Facultăţii de Matematică a Universităţii din Bucureşti, universitate în care şi lucrează din anul 1990. Din anul 1996 reprezintă minoritatea armeană (Uniunea Armenilor din România) şi comunitatea IT&C din România în Parlament. În această perioadă a iniţiat 74 de proiecte de acte normative, multe devenite în timp legi, şi este autorul a peste 1800 de amendamente. Are dezvoltări teoretice și experimentale în astrofizică solară și teoria gravitației. A predat Astronomie Teoretică, Mecanică Cerească, Teoria Relativității, Magnetohidrodinamică, Astrofizică, Metoda Elementului Finit, Arhitecturi de sisteme de calcul, Economie Digitală. Ştie să programeze în FORTRAN, C++, C# şi VisualBasic. A dezvoltat soft și arhitecturi software pentru mai multe sisteme de operare (CP/M, RSX-11, UNIX, VMS, MSDOS, Windows) şi pe mai multe platforme software (.Net, Windows Azure). Cunoaște trei limbaje de asamblare (pentru PDP-11, VAX şi PC). Domenii de interes actuale: Educație, Teoria Relativistă a Gravitației, Bioinformatică, Economie Digitală, IT&C.
meetup-CoFoundersLab-Cluj-237952963.title: Workshop Economia Digitala cu Prof. Dr. Varujan Pambuccian

meetup-Java-Day-Cluj-Napoca-237927705.description:
Kevlin Henney, top industry software architect from UK, is speaker at Software Architecture Day Timisoara! 

Kevlin will sustain, on April 21, 2017, a full day workshop about The Architecture of Uncertainty: Creating software architecture in a world of change, uncertainty and incomplete knowledge


Kevlin Henney is independent consultant, speaker, writer and trainer. His software development interests are in patterns, programming, practice and process.

Kevlin has contributed to both open-and closed-source projects, and his work has inspired and has been the basis for a number of utility libraries and testing frameworks. He has been a contributor and columnist for many software development magazines and websites, including The Register, Better Software, IEEE Software, Java Report, C++ Report, C/C++ Users Journal, EXE and Application Development Advisor.


TOPICS:

• The relationship between development process and software architecture;

• The relationship between code and software architecture;

• Empirical and emergent software architecture and development practices;

• The role of change and uncertainty in coupling and modularity;

• How team size and organisational structure influence architectural evolution.


You can find more information here: www.timisoara.softwarearchitectureday.ro


Software Architecture Day is an unique event, designed for technical team leads, architects, engineering directors, and project managers who influence innovation in their teams.

Advanced Java 8 w. Richard Warburton

-The masterclass for Java developers

Richard Warburton - Independent Software Developer, Book Author and Technical Trainer, is speaker on March 23 at Java Day Iasi. He will support a hands-on workshop about Advanced Java 8.

Topics:

· Data Parallelism

· Testing and Debugging Lambdas

· Default and static methods on interfaces

· Enhanced Design with Lambdas

· Date & Time in Java 8

· The Optional data type

· CompletableFuture

About Richard:

Richard is an empirical technologist and solver of deep-dive technical problems and works independently as a Software Engineer and Trainer. 

He has written the book on Java 8 Lambdas for O’Reilly and he is a leader in the London Java Community. Richard is also a well known conference speaker, having talked at Devoxx, Javazone, JavaOne, JAX London, JEEConf, Codemotion Rome, and many more others. He obtained a PhD in Computer Science from The University of Warwick.

You can find more details here:

www.iasi.javaday.ro

Register at [masked].

You can find more details here: www.bucharest.javaday.ro

Register at [masked]. 

Java Day is an unique event, designed for technical team leads, architects, engineering directors, and project managers who influence innovation in their teams, and takes place every year in Cluj-Napoca, Timisoara, Iasi and Bucharest.

meetup-Lets-talk-DDD-237844733.description:
Ne prezentăm și apoi trecem direct la subiect: domain driven design.

O să fie o discuție deschisă. Vom vorbi despre DDD. Vreau să aflăm ce ne interesează și cum putem învăța unii de la alții. Fiecare are de contribuit și de învățat.

Sunt sigur ca ați mai auzit de DDD, poate ați mai lucrat cu el sau sunteți doar curioși. În orice caz cred că o să fie interesant.

meetup-PMI-Romania-Cluj-Napoca-Project-M.description:
PMI Romania Chapter has the pleasure of inviting you to a new Monthly Meeting in Cluj, on March 1st, 2017, hosted by BETFAIR.

Meeting Topic: What is a project manager? Multitasker, Influencer, Stressor?

Agenda
18:15 – 18:45   Registration / Snacks / Networking
18:45 – 19:00   PMI Presentation – Plans & Projects for 2017 – Cristina Has and Iustinian Șovrea
19:00 – 19:10   Host company presentation: BETFAIR – Paula Tibre
19:10 – 19:30   Presentation:  Multitasking - a Trojan horse? -Dan Mocan, Malina Mihaila

·  What is multitasking and Media Multitasking? Are PMs multitaskers?

·  Multitasking and different personality types (Supertaskers, Sensation seekers, etc.)

·  Impact on professional/personal life

·  Short-term/ Long – term impact

·  Multitasking at a company level

19:30 – 19:50   Presentation: PM = Stressor, Facilitator or Influencer - Petra Cîmpean, Mădălina Pintea

·  Appreciate and motivate – The importance of people in the implementation of a project.

·  Influencing and negotiating – How far can we push things?

·  Key concepts: people matter, team, influencing, negotiating.


19:50 – 20:00   Break / Snacks / Networking 


20:00 – 20:50   Panel Discussion 
20:50 –   Networking

Panel Members:


Dan Mocan – has over 6 years in the IT industry and more than 3 years in Project Management. Currently he is Delivery Assurance Lead at Betfair and he is dealing with the integration of Paddy Power and Betfair platforms. He is passionate about overcoming personal limits through sports and constantly exit the comfort zone.

Petra Cîmpean – Motivated by the evolution of a project from the first idea to final product/functionality. Fascinated by what can be achieved by a group of people through collaboration. Passionate about keeping things simple.

Vlad Panut – has over 10 years in the software industry. He is currently Unit Manager at Fortech. His areas of expertise are project and product management and business analysis.

Alexandru Tulai – has over 30 years of experience in the IT business and over 15 years in research and academia. He coordinated in Romania and abroad multiple projects and he has lead implementations of integrated software solutions for the support and development of companies from different business sectors, as well as governmental level projects. He is an active supporter and promoter of technology transfer and innovation.


Moderator: Cristina Has, PMP – over 6 years’ experience managing products, projects, programs and portfolios.

Please register here (only confirmed registrations will be considered).

Looking forward to having you with us!
meetup-PMI-Romania-Cluj-Napoca-Project-M.title: PMI Romania Chapter Monthly Meeting - Cluj, March 1st, 2017, Hosted by BETFAIR
meetup-PMI-Romania-Cluj-Napoca-Project-M.venue: Betfair Romania Development Cluj-Napoca: The Office building, Blvd. 21 Decembrie 1989, no. 77 ,Entrance A, 4th Floor , Cluj-Napoca

Asia Lindsay (Toptal.com - How To Hire & Manage A World-Class Remote Team)

We are back! :)

Our first guest at Startup Grind Cluj Napoca this year is Asia Lindsay, Europe Community Lead at Toptal.

Born in Hong Kong into a multicultural family. Lived in six other countries. Focused on community engagement, languages and forging intercultural connections. After she started the TED Coding Club, decided to go into tech and community.

Toptal is an exclusive network of the top freelance software developers, designers, and finance experts in the world.

Top companies rely on Toptal freelancers for their most important projects.

Please join us for an amazing evening with Asia, to find out how to hire and manage a world-class remote team.

March 29th, 18:00. ClujHub.

See you there!

Stefan & Startup Grind Team

Agenda

6:00 pm Networking

6:30 pm Startup Grind Chat

7:30 pm Friend Building & Snacks

Speaker

Asia Lindsay - Toptal

Hosted By

Stefan Koritar, Cluj-Napoca Director

Transilvania Tech Valley startup man. Product Manager at Telenav. Stefan is also a startup ecosystem enthusiast and builder, sharing at stefankoritar.com.


Twitter: @skoritar Global Partner

Google is committed to empowering entrepreneurs around the world through programs, partnerships, and our products.

What is Startup Grind?

Startup Grind is a global startup community designed to educate, inspire, and connect entrepreneurs. We host monthly events in more than 200 cities and 98 countries featuring successful local founders, innovators, educators and investors who share personal stories and lessons learned on the road to building great companies. Our monthly fireside chat interviews, startup mixers and annual conferences provide ample opportunities to connect with amazing startups and the people behind them, tap into a strong support network, form meaningful connections and gain inspiration for the startup journey ahead. For more information visit StartupGrind.com or follow us on twitter @StartupGrind.

meetup-Tabara-de-Testare-Cluj-237661190.description:
Hello!

This meetup is a do-over, updated session from the testing track at Codecamp Cluj.

The content owner will be Levente Florisca. During this presentation, he aims to cover the following:

What is software testing? It is simply understanding the functionality and architecture of a piece of software and test it until fear of not finding any bugs turns to boredom? But what about coding? Is that required for a tester or it is a knowledge exclusively for developers? Does coding help in the software testing? Is automation a fantasy, in a euphoric world? The difference between software delivering and software developing / testing is a topic which can be discussed until the edge of infinity. The pros and cons of each side will be discussed from a QA point of view.

Levi started to learn, after few years he was asked to tutor, teach and train others in the magical land of automation and testing. He's been holding workshops and training at companies for more than 2 years now, the rest of his info can be tracked on social media.

***About TdT

1. Meetup starts at 18:30.

Please show up at 18:15 to ensure a smooth and proper start of the event.

2. Each meetup has the following workflow:

- by the organizers/facilitators: introduction to Tabara de Testare

- by the speaker: speaker background & then the presentation / workshop itself

- each participant is invited to donate 15 lei to cover the expenses for the location


3. TdT online presence:

- Blog: http://tabaradetestare.ro/

- Slideshare: http://www.slideshare.net/tabaradetestare

- Twitter: @tabaradetestare

- Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Tabara.de.Testare?fref=ts

! Please mention if you do not wish to be photographed or have your picture posted online !

Thank you,

TdT Team
meetup-Tabara-de-Testare-Cluj-237661190.title: Meetup #60 - Does a software tester need to learn to code?

meetup-Tabara-de-Testare-Timisoara-mktmf.description:
Andreea Popescu a tinut un workshop de usability la Tabara de Toamna si a fost foarte apreciat.

Noi am invitat-o pe Andreea sa tina workshopul si in Timisoara.

===========================================

Mai jos e lista cu propunerile pe urmatorul an:

- Training SQL - Nivel Mediu (recapitulare nivel Basic, la inceput)

- Time and Risk Management

- Comunicare - colegi, dev/tester

* Biblioteca cu informatii utile:

- certificari, carti, linkuri (recomandare: http://testhuddle.com/)

- Technical movie nights: Pluralsight, Coursera

- UFT (QTP), Selenium WebDriver, TFS, SoapUI (basic training)

* Co-interesare: traininguri, conferinte, certificari

- Prezentari si workshop-uri "Eu am mai facut si vreau sa ajut"

- Prezentation Skills (Moderator Surpriza)

- .Net, Java, Html, CSS, Notiuni de OOP, etc - Basic -> Intermediate

- Prezentari cu traineri certificati

- Add fun stuff

- Database performance testing

- implementarea unor design patterns in testarea automata (in afara de Page Objects)

- Cum tot mai multi lucreaza in Agile, poate ar fi interesanta prezentarea unui mediu de continuos integration (principii, cum se lucreaza cu el si ce se poate face) din perspectiva testarii. - Done - la editia aniversara de 3 ani.

meetup-Tabara-de-Testare-Timisoara-mktmf.venue: ARIES-TM Asociatia Romana pentru Industria Electronica si Software - Filiala Timisoara: Str. Paris, nr. 2A, Timisoara, Timisoara

meetup-The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meet.description:
Hi,

Spring is coming. Let's celebrate this by having two talented women sharing their knowledge and experience with us.

First we have Steliana Moraru. In her presentation, Lessons from the communication trenches for management & leadership roles, she will share with us short case studies, lessons of successful communication or failed from working with technical teams & tech projects, useful for everyone in management & leadership position.

Steliana has a diverse background that spans communication, marketing, program management & corporate social responsibility. A technology aficionado and a seasoned communication professional, she currently wears a few hats: Marketing & Communication Manager for MozaicWorks, Ph.D. candidate in Communication & Public Relations, and University teaching assistant.
Previously, she worked as communication and program manager for local and international organisations, focusing mainly on developing innovative projects that enabled the power of technology for the social good. She is passionate about how technology can change and develop communities, data in all forms (her Ph.D thesis is takling the Big Data subject), and working people who want to drive a positive change.


Second speaker is to be announced.

Agenda:

18:45 - 19:00 Arriving, socializing
19:00 - 19:10 Introduction
19:10 - 19:40 Lessons from the communication trenches for management & leadership roles
19:40 - 20:10 To be announced 
20:10 - 20:20 Break
20:20 - 21:10 Open Space - ask the speakers for more details or propose interesting topics
21:10 - 21:20 Closing

See you on 14h of March!

See you soon,

Paul

meetup-angularjs-cluj-237753304.description:
Freelancing is seen from the outside as waking up late, working from coffee shops and making more money than the average employee. Some of these are true, but freelancers also deal with risk, late payments, difficult clients, uncomfortable timezones, distributed teams and more. It takes discipline, very good communication skills, some sales & marketing techniques and top notch technical know-how to make it as a successful freelancer.

To kick off the discussion we invited Tudor Fis to tell us about his experience as a freelancer. He has been working since 2009 for various clients in Europe and the US. If you are thinking about freelancing or you are already an experience freelancer we’d love to meet you. It will be an open discussion. Looking forward to your questions!
meetup-angularjs-cluj-237753304.title: Freelancing: how to start and how to succeed

meetup-angularjs-cluj-zhpzmmywfbcc.description:
Starting today we are planning on holding a recurring meetup in which we will discuss, document, build and more importantly contribute to open source projects.

We have used open source projects in our every day job, but rarely had the chance to contribute back and understand the environment better.

This meetup will help you improve your developer skills, working in a team, understanding how open source works and how to architect, develop and maintain an open source project.

The event will last for 2 hours in which we will do the following:

1. Discuss code you already worked on that you are thinking of making open source

2. Discuss ideas of open source projects you would like to contribute to

3. Organise your project: code, architecture, comments, issues, PRs, community message.

4. Contribute by writing code to one or multiple github repositories.

At the end of each event we will take a look at what PRs have been added/merged, see how we can improve our code and share new ideas with the community.

Requirements:

• laptop


• 2 hours of your time


• fun learning attitude


This event is as free as open source.
meetup-angularjs-cluj-zhpzmmywfbcc.title: Workshop: Contributing to Open Source

meetup-clujytech-237671313.title: Kickoff Event
meetup-clujytech-237671313.venue: Bulgakov Cafe: Inocentiu Micu Klein, 17, near the old city wall, Cluj-Napoca

meetup-fullstack-cluj-237753304.description:
Freelancing is seen from the outside as waking up late, working from coffee shops and making more money than the average employee. Some of these are true, but freelancers also deal with risk, late payments, difficult clients, uncomfortable timezones, distributed teams and more. It takes discipline, very good communication skills, some sales & marketing techniques and top notch technical know-how to make it as a successful freelancer.

To kick off the discussion we invited Tudor Fis to tell us about his experience as a freelancer. He has been working since 2009 for various clients in Europe and the US. If you are thinking about freelancing or you are already an experience freelancer we’d love to meet you. It will be an open discussion. Looking forward to your questions!
meetup-fullstack-cluj-237753304.title: Freelancing: how to start and how to succeed

meetup-fullstack-cluj-zhpzmmywmbhb.description:
Starting today we are planning on holding a recurring meetup in which we will discuss, document, build and more importantly contribute to open source projects.

We have used open source projects in our every day job, but rarely had the chance to contribute back and understand the environment better.

This meetup will help you improve your developer skills, working in a team, understanding how open source works and how to architect, develop and maintain an open source project.

The event will last for 2 hours in which we will do the following:

1. Discuss code you already worked on that you are thinking of making open source

2. Discuss ideas of open source projects you would like to contribute to

3. Organise your project: code, architecture, comments, issues, PRs, community message.

4. Contribute by writing code to one or multiple github repositories.

At the end of each event we will take a look at what PRs have been added/merged, see how we can improve our code and share new ideas with the community.

Requirements:

• laptop


• 2 hours of your time


• fun learning attitude


This event is as free as open source.
